column1: Rare Progressive Liver Disease - Primary Biliary Cirrhosis
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on Urso Forte for almost 3 years since being diagnosed. (500mg twice a day) and my blood work has been good. I do notice thinning hair as a side effect. I also have slight discomfort around by rib cage above the liver. Take advice and dont read then internet, and listen to your Drs. advice. Currently there are no other meds for this disease. I have contacted local NJ and PA hospitals to see if there are any trials on meds for PBC, but there are not. In the near future I would like to raise funds and awareness for others newly diagnosed.

column1: Rare Progressive Liver Disease - Primary Biliary Cirrhosis
column2: gamtn, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: The meds have kept me at a stage 3, I am veryhappy with that.  Side effects are hair loss,dry mouth & eyes, nausea if not taken with ameal.  On occasion when my drug benefits run out, I have purchased this drug froma Canadian pharmacy, it is about half theprice as in the US.

column1: Rare Progressive Liver Disease - Primary Biliary Cirrhosis
column2: mrschris, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: i was diagnosed with PBC bout 15 yrs ago. i have severe itching (Pruritus)24/7, cotton mouth, hair loss. had to go to Drs.every 6mths for check ups i never had a normal check up. levels were always elevated. now my biggest problem is i have no insurance and i can't afford my meds 2 keep it from progressing cause it cost over $400 mthly w/o insurance. i can't seem 2 get any help from anyone. i haven't been 2 the Drs. in almost 2 yrs for my check ups and been off my meds for over a year. i just don't know what to do anymore. i just keep getting sicker everyday.

column1: Rare Progressive Liver Disease - Primary Biliary Cirrhosis
column2: Tired of being tired, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on this medication for almost 10 years, 3 times a day and hadn't noticed any side effects other then some hair thinning. My condition has been listed as inactive and stable. I really haven't noticed any side effects although in the last year I was diagnosed with Osteoarthritis and Lupus which is another auto-immune disease. The side effcts from the arthritis and lupus almost mirror the Urso side effects so now I couldn't tell if the Urso is causing them.

column9: The worst side effect so far, after being on this drug for 1 1/2 yrs is hair loss.  My thick hair is thinner, more straight than curl.  I don't like it, but cannot stop taking it. So far its worked on the blood levels.

column1: Rare Progressive Liver Disease - Primary Biliary Cirrhosis
column2: meshrew, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with stage 1 PBC in 9/2005. It took about 12 months for my numbers to return to normal but since then, all tests have been normal. My only side effect has been an upset stomach when taken without food; easily remedied by taking with meals. I take 500 mg twice a day.  Once in a while I miss a dose.  I never take both doses at the same time (full 1000mg).  Tried it once and made me nauseous and headachy. Listen to doctors about PBC, not the web.
